symbols.name: eventConsumer
symbols.description: Adds a callback function which is called whenever there is a user triggered event.

returnValue.description: void

symbols.name: sap.esh.search.ui.SearchCompositeControl
symbols.description: This is the SAPUI5 composite control by the Enterprise Search Team which helps to make full use of the Enterprise Search Engine features built into ABAP and HANA. It includes a search input box including a suggestion dropdown, a result view which can have different visualisation, including tiles, list and table, filtering facets and more. This control is ready to use with an enterprise search backend service but also allows deep extension to match requirements of adopting applications.

properties.name: cssClass
properties.description: An additional CSS class to add to this control

properties.name: searchTerm
properties.description: Defines the initial search term for the search input.

properties.name: searchOnStart
properties.description: Defines if the search composite control will send a search request directly after loading, using given search term, data source and filter root condition settings.

properties.name: filterRootCondition
properties.description: Defines the filter root condition of a filter tree which shall be applied to the search request. This control only allows filter trees which have a the following structure: complex condition (root level) \ complex condition (attribute level) \ simple condition (attribute value level) Filter root conditions which do not follow this structure won't be accepted and an error will be thrown. Please see the below for a more in-depth example.

properties.name: sinaConfiguration
properties.description: Configuration for the Enterprise Search Client API.

properties.name: dataSource
properties.description: The id of the data source in which it will search right after initialization.

properties.name: exclusiveDataSource
properties.description: Data source id which is set when the UI is loaded and cannot be changed at run time. The following UI parts will be hidden: - data source select (dropdown) - data source tab bar - data source facet (facet panel) - data source name/link on result list (header section of item)

properties.name: resultViewTypes
properties.description: Defines selectable search result view types. The value can be set/get in attach event "searchFinished". Case 1: Search in Apps: result is displayed in a mandatory view type ["appSearchResult"], and it is not switchable. Case 2: Search in All or other Category: result is switchable between different view types. Possible values for the array items are "searchResultList" and "searchResultGrid". Case 3, Search in Business Object: result is switchable between different view types. Possible values for the array items are "searchResultList", "searchResultTable" and "searchResultGrid". Note: The value of resultViewTypes and resultViewType must be compatible to each other. After the result view type has been changed, the event 'resultViewTypeChanged' is fired.

properties.name: resultViewType
properties.description: Defines active search result view type. The value can be set/get in attach event "searchFinished", and it must be contained in resultViewTypes. Case 1, Search in Apps: result is displayed in a mandatory view type "appSearchResult". Case 2.1, Search in All or other Category (configuration.isUshell !== true): result is switchable between different view types. Possible value is "searchResultList", or "searchResultGrid". Case 2.2, Search in All or other Category (configuration.isUshell === true): result is displayed in a mandatory view type "searchResultList". Case 3, Search in Business Object: result is switchable between different view types. Possible value is "searchResultList", "searchResultTable" or "searchResultGrid". Note: The value of resultViewTypes and resultViewType must be compatible to each other. After the result view type has been changed, the event 'resultViewTypeChanged' is fired.

properties.name: resultViewSettings
properties.description: Defines a pair of search result view settings. The value is an object of properties resultViewTypes and resultViewType. An example: {resultViewTypes: ["searchResultList", "searchResultTable"], resultViewType: "searchResultList"} Find more detail in the definition of each child property. The value can be set/get in attached event "searchFinished". Function setResultViewSettings prevents incompatibility of sequential execution of functions setResultViewTypes and setResultViewType. Note: The value of resultViewTypes and resultViewType must be compatible to each other. After the result view type has been changed, the event 'resultViewTypeChanged' is fired.

properties.name: resultviewMasterDetailMode
properties.description: The result views are displayed in a master-detail mode. The event showResultDetail is fired whenever the detail button/indicator is clicked.

properties.name: tabStripsFormatter
properties.description: Function callback for formatting the datasource tabstrips in the top toolbar. To the callback function a list of datasources is passed. The callback functions return a modified list of datasources to be displayed in the tabstrips.

properties.name: folderMode
properties.description:
Activates the folder mode. Precondition for folder mode is 1) Search model: In the search model for the current datasource a hierarchy attribute (representing the folders) is defined 1.1) the hierarchy attribute is annotated with displayType=TREE and for the hierarchy there is a helper connector representing the hierarchy or 1.2) the current datasource is the helper datasource representing the folder hierarchy. The hierarchy attribute is annotated with displayType=FLAT 2) Search query: The folder mode is only active in case the search query has an empty search term and no filter conditions (except the hierarchy attribute) are set.

In folder mode and in case a folder filter is set the result view only shows direct children of a folder. In contrast the counts in the facets are calculated by counting direct and not direct children. In case the folder mode is not active the UI uses the search mode: The result list shows direct and not direct children of a folder. * @since 1.106.0

properties.name: folderModeForInitialSearch
properties.description: In case folderMode is set to true this boolean indicates whether for the initial search the folder mode is enabled.

properties.name: autoAdjustResultViewTypeInFolderMode
properties.description: In case folder mode is active: Automatically switch result view type to list in search mode and to table in folder mode.

properties.name: enableQueryLanguage
properties.description: Enables the query language for the hana_odata provider. With query language it is possible for the end user to enter complex search queries with logical operators.

properties.name: applicationComponent
properties.description: Relevant for SAP partners and SAP, the "Application Component" you expect customers to create incidents.

properties.name: facetPanelResizable
properties.description: Display a splitter bar to resize the left hand panel, containing all facets and filter criteria.

properties.name: facetPanelWidthInPercent
properties.description: Default size (percent) of the left hand panel, containing all facets and filter criteria. If "facetPanelResizable" is true, the width of the facet panel can be changed by the user.

properties.name: getCustomNoResultScreen
properties.description: Whenever a search has no results, a 'No Results Screen' is displayed. You can provide a custom control to be more specific and add some hints, links, buttons or other content.

properties.name: getSearchInputPlaceholderLabel
properties.description: A callback which returns customized "label" for placeholder text of search box in case there is no search term. The placeholder text (en) will be "Search In: <customPlaceholderLabel>".

properties.name: searchInputLocation
properties.description: Location of the search input box. The search input can be placed on the top of the control (SearchCompositeControl) or as part of the search bar By default the location is at the top, values are "Top" and "Searchbar".

experimental.text: this feature is experimental and the API may change.

properties.name: overwriteBrowserTitle
properties.description: Shall the window title be overwritten by this control? If true, the control will set the current search condition as window title. If false, it will not set or update the window title.

properties.name: defaultDataSource
properties.description: Data source id which is set when the UI is loaded or filter is reset. If dataSource is also set, dataSource will be used during UI load and this parameter will used only after filter is reset. When setting 'exclusiveDataSource' to 'true', do not set this parameter (will be ignored).

properties.name: optimizeForValueHelp
properties.description: The layout is optimized for object selection / value help (narrow view w/o facet panel).

properties.name: filterDataSources
properties.description: Callback for filtering the datasources displayed in the datasource dropdown listbox. The callback gets a list of datsources and returns the filtered list of datasources.

properties.name: facets
properties.description: Controls whether the facet functionality is available or not.

properties.name: facetVisibility
properties.description: A boolean which indicates whether the facet panel is initially openend or closed. This affects only the initial state of the facet panel. This initial state of the facet panel can be overwritten by the user, depending on the user's personalization settings.

properties.name: facetToggleButtonLocation
properties.description: Location of the button to show/hide facet panel. The button (filter icon) can be placed on the left (begin) or on the right (end) of the search bar. By default the button's location is at the beginning (left), values are "Begin" and "End". The property is not evaluated if facet panel is disabled, see property 'facets'.

experimental.text: this feature is experimental and the API may change.

properties.name: enableCharts
properties.description: A boolean for enabling chart visualizations (pie chart / bar chart facets). If set to true, facets can be viewed as a pie or bar chart (this cannot be deactivated at runtime).

properties.name: boSuggestions
properties.description: A boolean for enabling (business) object suggestions.

properties.name: displayFacetPanelInCaseOfNoResults
properties.description: When set to true the facet panel is displayed also in case there are no search results.

deprecated.text: this setting is ignored and the visibility of the facet panel is controlled by the end user.

properties.name: updateUrl
properties.description: A boolean indicating that the search state is written to the URL.

properties.name: renderSearchUrl
properties.description: A callback for rendering the search URL. The callback gets a list of url encoded parameters and returns the URL string. Typically you need to register this callback in case of 'updateUrl = true'.

properties.name: isSearchUrl
properties.description: A callback for checking whether a URL is a search-relevant URL. The callback receives a URL and returns 'true' in case the URL is a search-relevant URL. Typically you need to register this callback in case of 'updateUrl = true'.

properties.name: parseSearchUrlParameters
properties.description: A callback for parsing URL parameters. The callback receices URL parameters and returns modified URL parameters. This is an optional callback. In case you set 'updateUrl = true' typcically this callback is not needed.

properties.name: quickSelectDataSources
properties.description: A list of data sources to be displayed in the facet panel in the section "Collection".

properties.name: selectionChange
properties.description: A callback which is called whenever the selection of result view items changes.

deprecated.text: this setting is ignored, subscribe to event 'selectionChange'.

properties.name: initAsync
properties.description: An asynchronues callback which is called after the initialization of the search composite control.

properties.name: enableMultiSelectionResultItems
properties.description: Enables the multiselection mode of search result items. A checkbox is provided for each result item if the value is set to 'true'.

properties.name: resultviewSelectionMode
properties.description: To select result view items, enable multi-selection or single-selection mode. Shows checkboxes ('MultipleItems') or enables item press ('OneItem'). Values of configuration parameter `resultviewSelectionMode` are 'None', 'OneItem' and 'MultipleItems'. To show a button for switching selection mode on/off, see 'showSelectionToggleButton'. A checkbox is provided for each result item if the value is true. The setting is related to `resultviewMasterDetailMode` (master-detail mode). The event `showResultDetail` is fired whenever the detail button is clicked.

properties.name: showSelectionToggleButton
properties.description: Enables the selection toggle button in the search result list. The button is displayed on the top of search result view and allows to toggle the selection of all result items. The button is only displayed if the property 'resultviewSelectionMode' is not set to 'None'.

properties.name: pageSize
properties.description: The maximum count of search result items displayed on a page after a search. By clicking 'Show More' button, another page of result items of the same count (if available) will be displayed.

properties.name: formatFilterBarText
properties.description: Callback for formatting the filter string to be displayed on the filter bar (for closed facet panel).

properties.name: isFilterBarVisible
properties.description: Callback for checking whether the filter bar is visible.

properties.name: eventConsumers
properties.description: Adds a callback function which is called whenever there is a user or a technical event. A user event is an event which is triggered by the user interaction with the UI, such as clicking. A technical event is an event which is triggered by the internal events or events which can also be triggered by API.

properties.name: searchTermLengthLimit
properties.description: Limit for length of searchterm.

properties.name: limitAjaxRequests
properties.description: Prevents too many ajax requests in a short time.

aggregations.name: content
aggregations.description: Control instances which are part of this composite control.

events.name: searchStarted
events.description: Event is fired when search is started.

events.name: searchFinished
events.description: Event is fired when search is finished.

events.name: selectionChanged
events.description: Event is fired when selection on result view (list, table or grid) has changed.

events.name: resultViewTypeChanged
events.description: Event is fired after result view type got changed (list, table or grid).

events.name: showResultDetail
events.description: Event is fired after result view detail button is pressed (list, table or grid). To use this event, set the property 'resultviewMasterDetailMode' to 'true'.

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: ID for the new control, generated automatically if no ID is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: Initial settings for the new control

constructor.description: Constructs a new SearchCompositeControl to interact with SAP Enterprise Search Services.

events.name: resultViewTypeChanged
events.description: Event is fired after result view type got changed (list, table or grid).

events.name: searchFinished
events.description: Event is fired when search is finished.

events.name: searchStarted
events.description: Event is fired when search is started.

events.name: selectionChanged
events.description: Event is fired when selection on result view (list, table or grid) has changed.

events.name: showResultDetail
events.description: Event is fired after result view detail button is pressed (list, table or grid). To use this event, set the property 'resultviewMasterDetailMode' to 'true'.

methods.name: addContent

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: oContent
parameters.description: The content to add; if empty, nothing is inserted

methods.description: Adds some content to the aggregation {@link #getContent content}.

methods.name: attachResultViewTypeChanged

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: oData
parameters.description: An application-specific payload object that will be passed to the event handler along with the event object when firing the event

parameters.name: fnFunction
parameters.description: The function to be called when the event occurs

parameters.name: oListener
parameters.description: Context object to call the event handler with. Defaults to this sap.esh.search.ui.SearchCompositeControl itself

methods.description: Attaches event handler fnFunction to the {@link #event:resultViewTypeChanged resultViewTypeChanged} event of this sap.esh.search.ui.SearchCompositeControl. When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.esh.search.ui.SearchCompositeControl itself. Event is fired after result view type got changed (list, table or grid).

When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.esh.search.ui.SearchCompositeControl itself. Event is fired when search is finished.

Event is fired when search is started.

methods.name: attachSelectionChanged

parameters.name: fnFunction

methods.name: attachShowResultDetail

parameters.name: fnFunction

parameters.name: oListener
parameters.description: Context object to call the event handler with. Defaults to this sap.esh.search.ui.SearchCompositeControl itself

When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.esh.search.ui.SearchCompositeControl itself. Event is fired after result view detail button is pressed (list, table or grid). To use this event, set the property 'resultviewMasterDetailMode' to 'true'.

methods.name: destroyContent

methods.name: extend

returnValue.description: Created class / constructor function

parameters.name: sClassName
parameters.description: Name of the class being created

parameters.name: oClassInfo
parameters.description: Object literal with information about the class

parameters.name: FNMetaImpl
parameters.description: Constructor function for the metadata object; if not given, it defaults to the metadata implementation used by this class

methods.description: Creates a new subclass of class sap.esh.search.ui.SearchCompositeControl with name sClassName and enriches it with the information contained in oClassInfo. oClassInfo might contain the same kind of information as described in {@link sap.ui.layout.VerticalLayout.extend}.

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

methods.name: getApplicationComponent

returnValue.description: Value of property applicationComponent

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getApplicationComponent applicationComponent}. Relevant for SAP partners and SAP, the "Application Component" you expect customers to create incidents. Default value is "HAN-AS-INA-UI".

methods.name: getAutoAdjustResultViewTypeInFolderMode

returnValue.description: Value of property autoAdjustResultViewTypeInFolderMode

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getAutoAdjustResultViewTypeInFolderMode autoAdjustResultViewTypeInFolderMode}. In case folder mode is active: Automatically switch result view type to list in search mode and to table in folder mode. Default value is false.

methods.name: getBoSuggestions

returnValue.description: Value of property boSuggestions

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getBoSuggestions boSuggestions}. A boolean for enabling (business) object suggestions. Default value is false.

methods.name: getContent
methods.description:
Gets content of aggregation {@link #getContent content}.

Control instances which are part of this composite control.

methods.name: getCssClass

returnValue.description: Value of property cssClass

methods.description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getCssClass cssClass}.

An additional CSS class to add to this control

methods.name: getDataSource

returnValue.description: Value of property dataSource

methods.description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getDataSource dataSource}.

The id of the data source in which it will search right after initialization.

methods.name: getDefaultDataSource

returnValue.description: Value of property defaultDataSource

methods.description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getDefaultDataSource defaultDataSource}.

Data source id which is set when the UI is loaded or filter is reset. If dataSource is also set, dataSource will be used during UI load and this parameter will used only after filter is reset. When setting 'exclusiveDataSource' to 'true', do not set this parameter (will be ignored).

methods.name: getDisplayFacetPanelInCaseOfNoResults

returnValue.description: Value of property displayFacetPanelInCaseOfNoResults

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getDisplayFacetPanelInCaseOfNoResults displayFacetPanelInCaseOfNoResults}. When set to true the facet panel is displayed also in case there are no search results. Default value is false.

deprecated.text: this setting is ignored and the visibility of the facet panel is controlled by the end user.

methods.name: getEnableCharts

returnValue.description: Value of property enableCharts

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getEnableCharts enableCharts}. A boolean for enabling chart visualizations (pie chart / bar chart facets). If set to true, facets can be viewed as a pie or bar chart (this cannot be deactivated at runtime). Default value is false.

methods.name: getEnableMultiSelectionResultItems

returnValue.description: Value of property enableMultiSelectionResultItems

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getEnableMultiSelectionResultItems enableMultiSelectionResultItems}. Enables the multiselection mode of search result items. A checkbox is provided for each result item if the value is set to 'true'. Default value is false.

methods.name: getEnableQueryLanguage

returnValue.description: Value of property enableQueryLanguage

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getEnableQueryLanguage enableQueryLanguage}. Enables the query language for the hana_odata provider. With query language it is possible for the end user to enter complex search queries with logical operators. Default value is false.

methods.name: getEventConsumers

returnValue.description: Value of property eventConsumers

methods.description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getEventConsumers eventConsumers}.

Adds a callback function which is called whenever there is a user or a technical event. A user event is an event which is triggered by the user interaction with the UI, such as clicking. A technical event is an event which is triggered by the internal events or events which can also be triggered by API.

methods.name: getExclusiveDataSource

returnValue.description: Value of property exclusiveDataSource

methods.description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getExclusiveDataSource exclusiveDataSource}.

Data source id which is set when the UI is loaded and cannot be changed at run time. The following UI parts will be hidden: - data source select (dropdown) - data source tab bar - data source facet (facet panel) - data source name/link on result list (header section of item)

methods.name: getFacetPanelResizable

returnValue.description: Value of property facetPanelResizable

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getFacetPanelResizable facetPanelResizable}. Display a splitter bar to resize the left hand panel, containing all facets and filter criteria. Default value is true.

methods.name: getFacetPanelWidthInPercent

returnValue.description: Value of property facetPanelWidthInPercent

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getFacetPanelWidthInPercent facetPanelWidthInPercent}. Default size (percent) of the left hand panel, containing all facets and filter criteria. If "facetPanelResizable" is true, the width of the facet panel can be changed by the user. Default value is 25.

methods.name: getFacets

returnValue.description: Value of property facets

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getFacets facets}. Controls whether the facet functionality is available or not. Default value is true.

methods.name: getFacetToggleButtonLocation

returnValue.description: Value of property facetToggleButtonLocation

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getFacetToggleButtonLocation facetToggleButtonLocation}. Location of the button to show/hide facet panel. The button (filter icon) can be placed on the left (begin) or on the right (end) of the search bar. By default the button's location is at the beginning (left), values are "Begin" and "End". The property is not evaluated if facet panel is disabled, see property 'facets'. Default value is "Begin".

experimental.text: this feature is experimental and the API may change.

methods.name: getFacetVisibility

returnValue.description: Value of property facetVisibility

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getFacetVisibility facetVisibility}. A boolean which indicates whether the facet panel is initially openend or closed. This affects only the initial state of the facet panel. This initial state of the facet panel can be overwritten by the user, depending on the user's personalization settings. Default value is false.

methods.name: getFilterDataSources

returnValue.description: Value of property filterDataSources

methods.description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getFilterDataSources filterDataSources}.

Callback for filtering the datasources displayed in the datasource dropdown listbox. The callback gets a list of datsources and returns the filtered list of datasources.

methods.name: getFilterRootCondition

returnValue.description: Value of property filterRootCondition

methods.description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getFilterRootCondition filterRootCondition}.

Defines the filter root condition of a filter tree which shall be applied to the search request. This control only allows filter trees which have a the following structure: complex condition (root level) \ complex condition (attribute level) \ simple condition (attribute value level) Filter root conditions which do not follow this structure won't be accepted and an error will be thrown. Please see the below for a more in-depth example.

methods.name: getFolderMode

returnValue.description: Value of property folderMode

methods.description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getFolderMode folderMode}.

Activates the folder mode. Precondition for folder mode is 1) Search model: In the search model for the current datasource a hierarchy attribute (representing the folders) is defined 1.1) the hierarchy attribute is annotated with displayType=TREE and for the hierarchy there is a helper connector representing the hierarchy or 1.2) the current datasource is the helper datasource representing the folder hierarchy. The hierarchy attribute is annotated with displayType=FLAT 2) Search query: The folder mode is only active in case the search query has an empty search term and no filter conditions (except the hierarchy attribute) are set.

In folder mode and in case a folder filter is set the result view only shows direct children of a folder. In contrast the counts in the facets are calculated by counting direct and not direct children. In case the folder mode is not active the UI uses the search mode: The result list shows direct and not direct children of a folder.

methods.name: getFolderModeForInitialSearch

returnValue.description: Value of property folderModeForInitialSearch

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getFolderModeForInitialSearch folderModeForInitialSearch}. In case folderMode is set to true this boolean indicates whether for the initial search the folder mode is enabled. Default value is false.

methods.name: getFormatFilterBarText

returnValue.description: Value of property formatFilterBarText

methods.description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getFormatFilterBarText formatFilterBarText}.

Callback for formatting the filter string to be displayed on the filter bar (for closed facet panel).

methods.name: getGetCustomNoResultScreen

returnValue.description: Value of property getCustomNoResultScreen

methods.description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getGetCustomNoResultScreen getCustomNoResultScreen}.

Whenever a search has no results, a 'No Results Screen' is displayed. You can provide a custom control to be more specific and add some hints, links, buttons or other content.

methods.name: getGetSearchInputPlaceholderLabel

returnValue.description: Value of property getSearchInputPlaceholderLabel

methods.description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getGetSearchInputPlaceholderLabel getSearchInputPlaceholderLabel}.

A callback which returns customized "label" for placeholder text of search box in case there is no search term. The placeholder text (en) will be "Search In: <customPlaceholderLabel>".

methods.name: getInitAsync

returnValue.description: Value of property initAsync

methods.description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getInitAsync initAsync}.

An asynchronues callback which is called after the initialization of the search composite control.

methods.name: getInitializationStatus

returnValue.description: Promise<{success: boolean;error?: Error;}> If success is true, the initialization was successful. If success is false, the error property contains the error instance for further handling.

methods.description: Get the status of initialization. In unsuccessful case, the corresponding error instance is returned either.

methods.name: getIsFilterBarVisible

returnValue.description: Value of property isFilterBarVisible

methods.description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getIsFilterBarVisible isFilterBarVisible}.

Callback for checking whether the filter bar is visible.

methods.name: getIsSearchUrl

returnValue.description: Value of property isSearchUrl

methods.description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getIsSearchUrl isSearchUrl}.

A callback for checking whether a URL is a search-relevant URL. The callback receives a URL and returns 'true' in case the URL is a search-relevant URL. Typically you need to register this callback in case of 'updateUrl = true'.

methods.name: getLimitAjaxRequests

returnValue.description: Value of property limitAjaxRequests

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getLimitAjaxRequests limitAjaxRequests}. Prevents too many ajax requests in a short time. Default value is true.

methods.name: getMetadata

returnValue.description: Metadata object describing this class

methods.description: Returns a metadata object for class sap.esh.search.ui.SearchCompositeControl.

methods.name: getOptimizeForValueHelp

returnValue.description: Value of property optimizeForValueHelp

methods.description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getOptimizeForValueHelp optimizeForValueHelp}.

The layout is optimized for object selection / value help (narrow view w/o facet panel).

methods.name: getOverwriteBrowserTitle

returnValue.description: Value of property overwriteBrowserTitle

methods.description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getOverwriteBrowserTitle overwriteBrowserTitle}.

Shall the window title be overwritten by this control? If true, the control will set the current search condition as window title. If false, it will not set or update the window title.

methods.name: getPageSize

returnValue.description: Value of property pageSize

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getPageSize pageSize}. The maximum count of search result items displayed on a page after a search. By clicking 'Show More' button, another page of result items of the same count (if available) will be displayed. Default value is 10.

methods.name: getParseSearchUrlParameters

returnValue.description: Value of property parseSearchUrlParameters

methods.description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getParseSearchUrlParameters parseSearchUrlParameters}.

A callback for parsing URL parameters. The callback receices URL parameters and returns modified URL parameters. This is an optional callback. In case you set 'updateUrl = true' typcically this callback is not needed.

methods.name: getQuickSelectDataSources

returnValue.description: Value of property quickSelectDataSources

methods.description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getQuickSelectDataSources quickSelectDataSources}.

A list of data sources to be displayed in the facet panel in the section "Collection".

methods.name: getRenderSearchUrl

returnValue.description: Value of property renderSearchUrl

methods.description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getRenderSearchUrl renderSearchUrl}.

A callback for rendering the search URL. The callback gets a list of url encoded parameters and returns the URL string. Typically you need to register this callback in case of 'updateUrl = true'.

methods.name: getResultviewMasterDetailMode

returnValue.description: Value of property resultviewMasterDetailMode

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getResultviewMasterDetailMode resultviewMasterDetailMode}. The result views are displayed in a master-detail mode. The event showResultDetail is fired whenever the detail button/indicator is clicked. Default value is false.

methods.name: getResultviewSelectionMode

returnValue.description: Value of property resultviewSelectionMode

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getResultviewSelectionMode resultviewSelectionMode}. To select result view items, enable multi-selection or single-selection mode. Shows checkboxes ('MultipleItems') or enables item press ('OneItem'). Values of configuration parameter `resultviewSelectionMode` are 'None', 'OneItem' and 'MultipleItems'. To show a button for switching selection mode on/off, see 'showSelectionToggleButton'. A checkbox is provided for each result item if the value is true. The setting is related to `resultviewMasterDetailMode` (master-detail mode). The event `showResultDetail` is fired whenever the detail button is clicked. Default value is "None".

methods.name: getResultViewSettings

returnValue.description: Value of property resultViewSettings

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getResultViewSettings resultViewSettings}. Defines a pair of search result view settings. The value is an object of properties resultViewTypes and resultViewType. An example: {resultViewTypes: ["searchResultList", "searchResultTable"], resultViewType: "searchResultList"} Find more detail in the definition of each child property. The value can be set/get in attached event "searchFinished". Function setResultViewSettings prevents incompatibility of sequential execution of functions setResultViewTypes and setResultViewType. Note: The value of resultViewTypes and resultViewType must be compatible to each other. After the result view type has been changed, the event 'resultViewTypeChanged' is fired. Default value is ...see text or source.

methods.name: getResultViewType

returnValue.description: Value of property resultViewType

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getResultViewType resultViewType}. Defines active search result view type. The value can be set/get in attach event "searchFinished", and it must be contained in resultViewTypes. Case 1, Search in Apps: result is displayed in a mandatory view type "appSearchResult". Case 2.1, Search in All or other Category (configuration.isUshell !== true): result is switchable between different view types. Possible value is "searchResultList", or "searchResultGrid". Case 2.2, Search in All or other Category (configuration.isUshell === true): result is displayed in a mandatory view type "searchResultList". Case 3, Search in Business Object: result is switchable between different view types. Possible value is "searchResultList", "searchResultTable" or "searchResultGrid". Note: The value of resultViewTypes and resultViewType must be compatible to each other. After the result view type has been changed, the event 'resultViewTypeChanged' is fired. Default value is "searchResultList".

methods.name: getResultViewTypes

returnValue.description: Value of property resultViewTypes

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getResultViewTypes resultViewTypes}. Defines selectable search result view types. The value can be set/get in attach event "searchFinished". Case 1: Search in Apps: result is displayed in a mandatory view type ["appSearchResult"], and it is not switchable. Case 2: Search in All or other Category: result is switchable between different view types. Possible values for the array items are "searchResultList" and "searchResultGrid". Case 3, Search in Business Object: result is switchable between different view types. Possible values for the array items are "searchResultList", "searchResultTable" and "searchResultGrid". Note: The value of resultViewTypes and resultViewType must be compatible to each other. After the result view type has been changed, the event 'resultViewTypeChanged' is fired. Default value is ["searchResultList", "searchResultTable"].

methods.name: getSearchInputLocation

returnValue.description: Value of property searchInputLocation

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getSearchInputLocation searchInputLocation}. Location of the search input box. The search input can be placed on the top of the control (SearchCompositeControl) or as part of the search bar By default the location is at the top, values are "Top" and "Searchbar". Default value is "Top".

experimental.text: this feature is experimental and the API may change.

methods.name: getSearchOnStart

returnValue.description: Value of property searchOnStart

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getSearchOnStart searchOnStart}. Defines if the search composite control will send a search request directly after loading, using given search term, data source and filter root condition settings. Default value is true.

methods.name: getSearchTerm

returnValue.description: Value of property searchTerm

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getSearchTerm searchTerm}. Defines the initial search term for the search input. Default value is empty string.

methods.name: getSearchTermLengthLimit

returnValue.description: Value of property searchTermLengthLimit

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getSearchTermLengthLimit searchTermLengthLimit}. Limit for length of searchterm. Default value is 1000.

methods.name: getSelectionChange

returnValue.description: Value of property selectionChange

methods.description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getSelectionChange selectionChange}.

A callback which is called whenever the selection of result view items changes.

deprecated.text: this setting is ignored, subscribe to event 'selectionChange'.

methods.name: getShowSelectionToggleButton

returnValue.description: Value of property showSelectionToggleButton

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getShowSelectionToggleButton showSelectionToggleButton}. Enables the selection toggle button in the search result list. The button is displayed on the top of search result view and allows to toggle the selection of all result items. The button is only displayed if the property 'resultviewSelectionMode' is not set to 'None'. Default value is false.

methods.name: getSinaConfiguration

returnValue.description: Value of property sinaConfiguration

methods.description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getSinaConfiguration sinaConfiguration}.

Configuration for the Enterprise Search Client API.

methods.name: getTabStripsFormatter

returnValue.description: Value of property tabStripsFormatter

methods.description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getTabStripsFormatter tabStripsFormatter}.

Function callback for formatting the datasource tabstrips in the top toolbar. To the callback function a list of datasources is passed. The callback functions return a modified list of datasources to be displayed in the tabstrips.

methods.name: getUpdateUrl

returnValue.description: Value of property updateUrl

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getUpdateUrl updateUrl}. A boolean indicating that the search state is written to the URL. Default value is true.

methods.name: indexOfContent

returnValue.description: The index of the provided control in the aggregation if found, or -1 otherwise

parameters.name: oContent
parameters.description: The content whose index is looked for

methods.description: Checks for the provided sap.ui.core.Control in the aggregation {@link #getContent content}. and returns its index if found or -1 otherwise.

methods.name: insertContent

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: oContent
parameters.description: The content to insert; if empty, nothing is inserted

parameters.name: iIndex
parameters.description: The 0-based index the content should be inserted at; for a negative value of iIndex, the content is inserted at position 0; for a value greater than the current size of the aggregation, the content is inserted at the last position

methods.description: Inserts a content into the aggregation {@link #getContent content}.

methods.name: invalidateSearchResultCache
methods.description: Invalidate the search cache. To trigger a search in addition, use function 'retriggerSearch' instead.

methods.name: removeAllContent

returnValue.description: An array of the removed elements (might be empty)

methods.description:
Removes all the controls from the aggregation {@link #getContent content}.

Additionally, it unregisters them from the hosting UIArea.

methods.name: removeContent

returnValue.description: The removed content or null

parameters.name: vContent
parameters.description: The content to remove or its index or id

methods.description: Removes a content from the aggregation {@link #getContent content}.

methods.name: resetDataSource

parameters.name: fireQuery
parameters.description: If true, fires a search query right away. Set to 'false' for batch updates.

methods.description: Resets the active data source which is selected in the data source drop down list to its default (see 'defaultDataSource'/'exclusiveDataSource').

methods.name: resetSearch
methods.description: Resets the UI / search results (reset search query and fire a new search).

methods.name: retriggerSearch
methods.description: Fire a new search (includes invalidation of search cache). To invalidate the search cache w/o triggering a new search, use function 'invalidateSearchResultCache' instead.

methods.name: search

returnValue.description: Returns 'true' if the search query was fired, otherwise 'void'.

parameters.name: invalidateQuery
parameters.description: Indicates wether the search query should be resetted. Set to 'true' to reset the query.

parameters.name: fireQuery
parameters.description: Indicates wether the search query should be sent to the search service or not. Set to 'false', to prevent auto-update of search results.

methods.description: Invalidate the search cache and optionally fire a new search. Also see functions 'retriggerSearch' and 'invalidateSearchResultCache'.

methods.name: setApplicationComponent

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

methods.description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getApplicationComponent applicationComponent}. Relevant for SAP partners and SAP, the "Application Component" you expect customers to create incidents. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is "HAN-AS-INA-UI".

methods.name: setAutoAdjustResultViewTypeInFolderMode

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

methods.description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getAutoAdjustResultViewTypeInFolderMode autoAdjustResultViewTypeInFolderMode}. In case folder mode is active: Automatically switch result view type to list in search mode and to table in folder mode. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is false.

methods.name: setBoSuggestions

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

methods.description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getBoSuggestions boSuggestions}. A boolean for enabling (business) object suggestions. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is false.

methods.name: setCssClass

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

methods.description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getCssClass cssClass}. An additional CSS class to add to this control When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

methods.name: setDataSource

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

methods.description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getDataSource dataSource}. The id of the data source in which it will search right after initialization. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

methods.name: setDefaultDataSource

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

methods.description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getDefaultDataSource defaultDataSource}. Data source id which is set when the UI is loaded or filter is reset. If dataSource is also set, dataSource will be used during UI load and this parameter will used only after filter is reset. When setting 'exclusiveDataSource' to 'true', do not set this parameter (will be ignored). When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

methods.name: setDisplayFacetPanelInCaseOfNoResults

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

methods.description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getDisplayFacetPanelInCaseOfNoResults displayFacetPanelInCaseOfNoResults}. When set to true the facet panel is displayed also in case there are no search results. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is false.

deprecated.text: this setting is ignored and the visibility of the facet panel is controlled by the end user.

methods.name: setEnableCharts

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

methods.description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getEnableCharts enableCharts}. A boolean for enabling chart visualizations (pie chart / bar chart facets). If set to true, facets can be viewed as a pie or bar chart (this cannot be deactivated at runtime). When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is false.

methods.name: setEnableMultiSelectionResultItems

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

methods.description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getEnableMultiSelectionResultItems enableMultiSelectionResultItems}. Enables the multiselection mode of search result items. A checkbox is provided for each result item if the value is set to 'true'. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is false.

methods.name: setEnableQueryLanguage

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

methods.description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getEnableQueryLanguage enableQueryLanguage}. Enables the query language for the hana_odata provider. With query language it is possible for the end user to enter complex search queries with logical operators. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is false.

methods.name: setEventConsumers

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

methods.description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getEventConsumers eventConsumers}. Adds a callback function which is called whenever there is a user or a technical event. A user event is an event which is triggered by the user interaction with the UI, such as clicking. A technical event is an event which is triggered by the internal events or events which can also be triggered by API. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

methods.name: setExclusiveDataSource

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

methods.description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getExclusiveDataSource exclusiveDataSource}. Data source id which is set when the UI is loaded and cannot be changed at run time. The following UI parts will be hidden: - data source select (dropdown) - data source tab bar - data source facet (facet panel) - data source name/link on result list (header section of item) When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

methods.name: setFacetPanelResizable

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

methods.description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getFacetPanelResizable facetPanelResizable}. Display a splitter bar to resize the left hand panel, containing all facets and filter criteria. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is true.

methods.name: setFacetPanelWidthInPercent

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

methods.description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getFacetPanelWidthInPercent facetPanelWidthInPercent}. Default size (percent) of the left hand panel, containing all facets and filter criteria. If "facetPanelResizable" is true, the width of the facet panel can be changed by the user. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is 25.

methods.name: setFacets

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

methods.description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getFacets facets}. Controls whether the facet functionality is available or not. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is true.

methods.name: setFacetToggleButtonLocation

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

methods.description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getFacetToggleButtonLocation facetToggleButtonLocation}. Location of the button to show/hide facet panel. The button (filter icon) can be placed on the left (begin) or on the right (end) of the search bar. By default the button's location is at the beginning (left), values are "Begin" and "End". The property is not evaluated if facet panel is disabled, see property 'facets'. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is "Begin".

experimental.text: this feature is experimental and the API may change.

methods.name: setFacetVisibility

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

methods.description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getFacetVisibility facetVisibility}. A boolean which indicates whether the facet panel is initially openend or closed. This affects only the initial state of the facet panel. This initial state of the facet panel can be overwritten by the user, depending on the user's personalization settings. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is false.

methods.name: setFilterDataSources

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

methods.description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getFilterDataSources filterDataSources}. Callback for filtering the datasources displayed in the datasource dropdown listbox. The callback gets a list of datsources and returns the filtered list of datasources. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

methods.name: setFilterRootCondition

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

methods.description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getFilterRootCondition filterRootCondition}. Defines the filter root condition of a filter tree which shall be applied to the search request. This control only allows filter trees which have a the following structure: complex condition (root level) \ complex condition (attribute level) \ simple condition (attribute value level) Filter root conditions which do not follow this structure won't be accepted and an error will be thrown. Please see the below for a more in-depth example. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

methods.name: setFolderMode

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property {@link #getFolderMode folderMode}.

Activates the folder mode. Precondition for folder mode is 1) Search model: In the search model for the current datasource a hierarchy attribute (representing the folders) is defined 1.1) the hierarchy attribute is annotated with displayType=TREE and for the hierarchy there is a helper connector representing the hierarchy or 1.2) the current datasource is the helper datasource representing the folder hierarchy. The hierarchy attribute is annotated with displayType=FLAT 2) Search query: The folder mode is only active in case the search query has an empty search term and no filter conditions (except the hierarchy attribute) are set.

In folder mode and in case a folder filter is set the result view only shows direct children of a folder. In contrast the counts in the facets are calculated by counting direct and not direct children. In case the folder mode is not active the UI uses the search mode: The result list shows direct and not direct children of a folder.

methods.name: setFolderModeForInitialSearch

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

methods.description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getFolderModeForInitialSearch folderModeForInitialSearch}. In case folderMode is set to true this boolean indicates whether for the initial search the folder mode is enabled. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is false.

methods.name: setFormatFilterBarText

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

methods.description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getFormatFilterBarText formatFilterBarText}. Callback for formatting the filter string to be displayed on the filter bar (for closed facet panel). When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

methods.name: setGetCustomNoResultScreen

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

methods.description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getGetCustomNoResultScreen getCustomNoResultScreen}. Whenever a search has no results, a 'No Results Screen' is displayed. You can provide a custom control to be more specific and add some hints, links, buttons or other content. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

methods.name: setGetSearchInputPlaceholderLabel

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

methods.description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getGetSearchInputPlaceholderLabel getSearchInputPlaceholderLabel}. A callback which returns customized "label" for placeholder text of search box in case there is no search term. The placeholder text (en) will be "Search In: ". When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

methods.name: setInitAsync

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

methods.description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getInitAsync initAsync}. An asynchronues callback which is called after the initialization of the search composite control. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

methods.name: setIsFilterBarVisible

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

methods.description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getIsFilterBarVisible isFilterBarVisible}. Callback for checking whether the filter bar is visible. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

methods.name: setIsSearchUrl

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

methods.description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getIsSearchUrl isSearchUrl}. A callback for checking whether a URL is a search-relevant URL. The callback receives a URL and returns 'true' in case the URL is a search-relevant URL. Typically you need to register this callback in case of 'updateUrl = true'. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

methods.name: setLimitAjaxRequests

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

methods.description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getLimitAjaxRequests limitAjaxRequests}. Prevents too many ajax requests in a short time. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is true.

methods.name: setOptimizeForValueHelp

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

methods.description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getOptimizeForValueHelp optimizeForValueHelp}. The layout is optimized for object selection / value help (narrow view w/o facet panel). When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

methods.name: setOverwriteBrowserTitle

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

methods.description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getOverwriteBrowserTitle overwriteBrowserTitle}. Shall the window title be overwritten by this control? If true, the control will set the current search condition as window title. If false, it will not set or update the window title. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

methods.name: setPageSize

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

methods.description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getPageSize pageSize}. The maximum count of search result items displayed on a page after a search. By clicking 'Show More' button, another page of result items of the same count (if available) will be displayed. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is 10.

methods.name: setParseSearchUrlParameters

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

methods.description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getParseSearchUrlParameters parseSearchUrlParameters}. A callback for parsing URL parameters. The callback receices URL parameters and returns modified URL parameters. This is an optional callback. In case you set 'updateUrl = true' typcically this callback is not needed. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

methods.name: setQuickSelectDataSources

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

methods.description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getQuickSelectDataSources quickSelectDataSources}. A list of data sources to be displayed in the facet panel in the section "Collection". When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

methods.name: setRenderSearchUrl

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

methods.description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getRenderSearchUrl renderSearchUrl}. A callback for rendering the search URL. The callback gets a list of url encoded parameters and returns the URL string. Typically you need to register this callback in case of 'updateUrl = true'. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

methods.name: setResultviewMasterDetailMode

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

methods.description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getResultviewMasterDetailMode resultviewMasterDetailMode}. The result views are displayed in a master-detail mode. The event showResultDetail is fired whenever the detail button/indicator is clicked. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is false.

methods.name: setResultviewSelectionMode

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

methods.description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getResultviewSelectionMode resultviewSelectionMode}. To select result view items, enable multi-selection or single-selection mode. Shows checkboxes ('MultipleItems') or enables item press ('OneItem'). Values of configuration parameter `resultviewSelectionMode` are 'None', 'OneItem' and 'MultipleItems'. To show a button for switching selection mode on/off, see 'showSelectionToggleButton'. A checkbox is provided for each result item if the value is true. The setting is related to `resultviewMasterDetailMode` (master-detail mode). The event `showResultDetail` is fired whenever the detail button is clicked. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is "None".

methods.name: setResultViewSettings

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

methods.description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getResultViewSettings resultViewSettings}. Defines a pair of search result view settings. The value is an object of properties resultViewTypes and resultViewType. An example: {resultViewTypes: ["searchResultList", "searchResultTable"], resultViewType: "searchResultList"} Find more detail in the definition of each child property. The value can be set/get in attached event "searchFinished". Function setResultViewSettings prevents incompatibility of sequential execution of functions setResultViewTypes and setResultViewType. Note: The value of resultViewTypes and resultViewType must be compatible to each other. After the result view type has been changed, the event 'resultViewTypeChanged' is fired. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is ...see text or source.

methods.name: setResultViewType

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

methods.description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getResultViewType resultViewType}. Defines active search result view type. The value can be set/get in attach event "searchFinished", and it must be contained in resultViewTypes. Case 1, Search in Apps: result is displayed in a mandatory view type "appSearchResult". Case 2.1, Search in All or other Category (configuration.isUshell !== true): result is switchable between different view types. Possible value is "searchResultList", or "searchResultGrid". Case 2.2, Search in All or other Category (configuration.isUshell === true): result is displayed in a mandatory view type "searchResultList". Case 3, Search in Business Object: result is switchable between different view types. Possible value is "searchResultList", "searchResultTable" or "searchResultGrid". Note: The value of resultViewTypes and resultViewType must be compatible to each other. After the result view type has been changed, the event 'resultViewTypeChanged' is fired. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is "searchResultList".

methods.name: setResultViewTypes

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

methods.description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getResultViewTypes resultViewTypes}. Defines selectable search result view types. The value can be set/get in attach event "searchFinished". Case 1: Search in Apps: result is displayed in a mandatory view type ["appSearchResult"], and it is not switchable. Case 2: Search in All or other Category: result is switchable between different view types. Possible values for the array items are "searchResultList" and "searchResultGrid". Case 3, Search in Business Object: result is switchable between different view types. Possible values for the array items are "searchResultList", "searchResultTable" and "searchResultGrid". Note: The value of resultViewTypes and resultViewType must be compatible to each other. After the result view type has been changed, the event 'resultViewTypeChanged' is fired. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is ["searchResultList", "searchResultTable"].

methods.name: setSearchInputLocation

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

methods.description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getSearchInputLocation searchInputLocation}. Location of the search input box. The search input can be placed on the top of the control (SearchCompositeControl) or as part of the search bar By default the location is at the top, values are "Top" and "Searchbar". When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is "Top".

experimental.text: this feature is experimental and the API may change.

methods.name: setSearchOnStart

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

methods.description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getSearchOnStart searchOnStart}. Defines if the search composite control will send a search request directly after loading, using given search term, data source and filter root condition settings. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is true.

methods.name: setSearchTerm

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

methods.description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getSearchTerm searchTerm}. Defines the initial search term for the search input. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is empty string.

methods.name: setSearchTermLengthLimit

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

methods.description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getSearchTermLengthLimit searchTermLengthLimit}. Limit for length of searchterm. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is 1000.

methods.name: setSelectionChange

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

methods.description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getSelectionChange selectionChange}. A callback which is called whenever the selection of result view items changes. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

deprecated.text: this setting is ignored, subscribe to event 'selectionChange'.

methods.name: setShowSelectionToggleButton

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

methods.description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getShowSelectionToggleButton showSelectionToggleButton}. Enables the selection toggle button in the search result list. The button is displayed on the top of search result view and allows to toggle the selection of all result items. The button is only displayed if the property 'resultviewSelectionMode' is not set to 'None'. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is false.

methods.name: setSinaConfiguration

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

methods.description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getSinaConfiguration sinaConfiguration}. Configuration for the Enterprise Search Client API. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

methods.name: setTabStripsFormatter

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

methods.description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getTabStripsFormatter tabStripsFormatter}. Function callback for formatting the datasource tabstrips in the top toolbar. To the callback function a list of datasources is passed. The callback functions return a modified list of datasources to be displayed in the tabstrips. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

methods.name: setUpdateUrl

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

methods.description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getUpdateUrl updateUrl}. A boolean indicating that the search state is written to the URL. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is true.

methods.name: updateStaticHierarchyFacet
methods.description: Update hierarchy facet Updates the one and only (static) hierarchy facet (tree control on facet panel). If no hierarchy facet exists, nothing will happen.
